_header: O cruel danger all mine adversary
Subjects: complaints, on evils of the time; lovers, advice to; advice, to lovers; lover’s lament
_description: A Compleynt against daunger, possibly by the Duke of Suffolk — three 8-line stanzas

BodFair16.First Lines:
O cruell daunger all myn aduersaryeOf whom alle louers aught sore
                    to complayne…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…Vpon this to make apoyntementThat fro hens forth alle partyse
                    may be plesyd
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
BodFair16.Editions:

             “An English Friend of Charles d’Orleáns.”

         26 (1911): 142-180: 161-2.
